intro: Crotalaria densicephala, commonly known as the dense-headed crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, ovate leaflets and produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. Its seed pods are cylindrical and dehiscent, releasing seeds when mature. Crotalaria densicephala is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
